title: Name & Address
desc: Check for the correct full name and address on your paperwork.

title: VIN
desc: Confirm the vehicle's VIN matches your paperwork.

title: Monroney sticker
desc: Verify that the vehicle's Monroney record matches your configuration.

title: Head light fit
desc: Check the head light fit

title: Intake vent paint
desc: Inspect the paint around intake vents on the front bumper

title: Frunk paint
desc: Inspect the frunk, look for paint defects, dents and signs of improper closing by the sides of the T logo

title: Hood
desc: Make sure the hood sits flush with the quarter panels and frunk

title: Windshield fit
desc: Inspect that the windshield isn't installed shifted (the gaps between the glass and A pillar on either side should be approximately equal). An improperly installed windshield causes significant wind noise at highway speeds.

title: Pannel gaps
desc: Check for uneven/wide panel gaps and that panels are flush to car

title: Trim
desc: Check for trim stains

title: Door leavers
desc: Check all 4 door levers

title: Pillars
desc: Check for dings on pillars

title: Paint
desc: Inspect the paint on the outside and the door jams, ensure panel corners do not have chips

title: Tail lights
desc: Check the tail light fit

title: Lights
desc: Check all front and rear exterior lights for signs of internal condensation.

title: Charging port
desc: Check charging port fit (driver side)

title: Wheels
desc: Check all wheels, make sure they arenâ€™t scratched

title: Hubcaps
desc: Confirm all 4 hubcaps are present and properly attached

title: Wheel well
desc: Inspect all wheel wells. Each wheel well is fitted with noise dampener covers that are attached to the body with a combination of plastic pins (pushed in all the way) and metal threaded pins (sticking out) with plastic nuts. Confirm that all plastic pins are present (there are no empty holes) and all metal pins (2 in each front wheel well, 4 in each rear wheel well) are present and properly attached.

title: Rocker panels
desc: Check for damage to black rocker panels

title: Undercarriage
desc: Inspect the undercarriage, look for damage, missing screws, or screws that are sticking out

title: Lights
desc: Turn on the lights on the car including: ambient light, fog lights, head lights, tail lights, reverse light, brake, signal lights (head light signal and side signal lights)

title: Wipers
desc: Check that wipers function correctly and look for potential wiper dings on hood

title: Glass
desc: Inspect every glass and make sure there are no distortion, scratches or cracks

title: Trim scratches
desc: Check for trim scratches on windows due to a software bug that doesn't automatically lower the window when opening the door

title: Charge port
desc: Verify that the charge port opens and closes

title: Rubber gasket
desc: Verify that the rubber gasket is properly attached to the bottom of all 4 doors.

title: Doors
desc: Test all doors to ensure they open and close without unreasonable effort or sound. Check paint in areas such as door hinges, that are not visible when doors are closed. NOTE: Some deliveries have reported incomplete body painting in hidden areas.

title: Screen
desc: Inspect the screen for scratches

title: Error messages
desc: Check for any error messages on the display screen.

title: Phantom touches
desc: Touch the "Tesla T" at the top of the screen to bring up the "About Your Tesla" window. Tap the unicorn drawing to access the Sketch Pad. Leave the Sketch Pad up for a minute to make sure there are no phantom touches happening on the display.

title: Steering wheel
desc: Inspect the steering wheel, check front & back for scratches or tears

title: Steering position
desc: Test the steering wheel position controls to ensure proper operation.

title: Horn
desc: Press the center of the steering wheel to make sure the vehicle's horn works.

title: Center console
desc: Inspect the center console scratches, dings, etc.

title: Dash
desc: Inspect the dash for scratches

title: Sun-visor
desc: Check sun-visor operation and mirror condition

title: Rearview mirror
desc: Check the rearview mirror for any warping or distortion.

title: Rearview mirror
desc: Check the rearview mirror for any warping or distortion.

title: Wireless charging
desc: Verify that wireless charging works on both sides

title: Wired charging
desc: Confirm wired charging works (1 x USB-A in front, 3 x USB-C, front and back)

title: Glovebox
desc: Open and close the glovebox

title: Windows
desc: Open and close windows using one click open close and manually open and close (make sure there are no noises and they stay up when you close, and when they go down they do all the way down for front two windows. The rear two windows don't go down all the way.

title: Windows
desc: Ensure door windows auto-close completely when doors are closed.

title: Cameras
desc: Verify backup camera

title: Speakers
desc: Play a familiar track through the sound system and confirm that all speakers work (use the balance and fader controls) and there are no unexpected clicks, etc.

title: Vehicle information
desc: Check the vehicle's display screen for any information that does not match the vehicle (found by tapping the Tesla "T").

title: Mirrors
desc: Fold mirrors

title: Interior lights
desc: Check all interior lights, and that all reading lights turn on with a press

title: Windshield
desc: Check for proper windshield and windshield trim installation.

title: Roof glass
desc: Inspect all edges of the roof glass panel and rear window.

title: Headliner
desc: Inspect the headliner all around (no grease, damage or scuffs)

title: Coat hooks
desc: Inspect both coat hooks (should extend, retract and latch)

title: Stalks
desc: Check that turn signal and drive selection stalks work and actuate smoothly

title: Door sill
desc: Look for scratches on the passenger side door sill

title: Seat belts
desc: Check all seat belts for proper operation.

title: Seats
desc: Check all seats for scuffs/damage/bad seams

title: Back seat
desc: Try to lift the bottom of the back seat to ensure it is securely attached to its base.

title: Front Seats
desc: Verify all front seat adjustments, including lumbar support

title: Seat heaters
desc: Confirm seat heaters work

title: Middle seat
desc: Confirm the middle seat on back row is flush at both ends

title: Back seats
desc: Confirm that back seats recline adjustment works correctly

title: Floor mats
desc: Inspect the floor mats for rips, stains, etc.

title: Accelerator
desc: Inspect the metal accelerator and brake pedal arms; there have been reports of different finish on pedals (matte on accelerator, glossy on brake) and a conspicuous weld in the middle of the brake pedal

title: Climate control
desc: Turn on climate control, force the heat pump to kick in by taking the temperature to either end of the scale and listen for loud noises

title: Frunk
desc: Test opening and closing of the frunk. Check paint in areas that are not visible when frunk and trunk are closed. NOTE: Some deliveries have reported incomplete body painting in hidden areas.

title: Frunk clips
desc: Verify the clips holding the trim area around the frunk

title: Tow hook
desc: Confirm the tow hook isn't missing

title: Lift gate
desc: Open & close the lift gate; sometimes the gasket gets caught in the molding, causing a click

title: Lift gate
desc: Confirm the lift gate opens and closes without "shuddering" and that the button on the hatch works to close it

title: Cargo covers
desc: Inspect the cargo covers and verify they're properly attached

title: Trunk buttons
desc: Confirm both button in trun fold the back seats

title: Folding seats
desc: Confirm folding rear seats do not catch on the rear trunk floor carpeting

title: Back seat
desc: Inspect the back seat covers and verify they're properly attached

title: Chargin cable
desc: Confirm the charging cable and the J1772 adapter aren't missing

title: License plate bracket
desc: Check for front license plate bracket (if applicable in your state).

title: Tow hitch
desc: Check for the tow harness (if tow hitch was ordered).

title: Charge car
desc: Confirm (car battery) charging works
